page.title: 02H0USING SURVEY
page.content: Askam not having any detailed land use plan or clear guide to areas suitable for new development, the problem for housing is aggrevated by the demand for new residential land. There has however been a steady amount of new building in recent years mainly because Askam is designated suitable for substantial expansion in the subsequent County Development Plan. The problem is now more pressing because of the influx of residents working in the nearby industrial area of Barrow. There are outstanding planning permissions for some fifty or so dwellings,some of these will no doubt improve some of the derelict landscape. There is also scope for residential development adjacent to existing houses.Further development may follow.
